before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"eemv8","text":"AR and BR oligo aliquots can be prepared in advance by combining equal volumes of Tn5ME-A/B and Tn5ME-R. Store at -20C. To use, thaw on bench, vortex and quick spin, then proceed to step 3. This is recommended to minimize freeze/thaw cycles on oligo stocks.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ag3ju","text":"A normalized gDNA plate should be prepared before starting. 10-20ng/ul is sufficient. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"bgj73","text":"This protocol is a fork of (dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bv5gn83w), which a demonstrated efficient and high-throughput tagmentation sequencing library prep protocol based on Picelli et al 2014. In this version, the tagmentation and amplification steps remain largely the same - based on the Tn5 transposase and KAPA HiFi kit, respectively. Here, significant modifications have been made to the library pooling and cleanup processes. Specifically, this protocol involves pooling the crude PCR products, followed by the removal of small fragments via a spin column kit, and depletion of large fragments through agarose gel extraction. These modifications enable faster processing times while still producing high quality sequencing libraries.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":28,"length":41}],"data":{}},{"key":"badbd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e91qj","text":"This protocol has been optimized for sequencing Drosophila cell culture samples, from which high-quality genomic DNA (gDNA) can be readily obtained. The accessibility to high-quality gDNA simplifies the normalization of gDNA input amounts prior to tagmentation, thereby streamlining the pooling and cleanup steps.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"E1E55A40EA6411EEB9010A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bv5gn83w"}}}}

Information presented in this protocol should not substitute for independent professional judgment, advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Any action you take or refrain from taking using or relying upon the information presented here is strictly at your own risk. You agree that neither the Company nor any of the authors, contributors, administrators, or anyone else associated with protocols.io, can be held responsible for your use of the information contained in or linked to this protocol or any of our Sites/Apps and Services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":631,"length":12}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}

fork_info.title: Tn5 based tagmentation library prep protocol, high throughput
